intro: Lactuca leucophaea var. integrifolia, commonly known as the white lettuce or silverleaf lettuce, is a variant of the lactuca genus characterized by its distinctive silvery-white undersides on the leaves. It is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in temperate climates with well-drained soil. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring broad, lobed leaves that are tender and edible. Its flowers are small and yellow, appearing in clusters, and it is often cultivated for its mild, nutty flavor. This variety is valued in both culinary and ornamental gardening for its unique appearance and versatility.
